snippet: The champagne bubbled, balloons kissed the ceiling and Loretta Sanchez stood center stage two weeks after the election, savoring the clatter of voices at her official victory party, thinking to herself it was all finally over.    She had defeated ...
lead_paragraph: The champagne bubbled, balloons kissed the ceiling and Loretta Sanchez stood center stage two weeks after the election, savoring the clatter of voices at her official victory party, thinking to herself it was all finally over. She had defeated Representative Robert K. Dornan, the brash Orange County, Calif., conservative, by 984 votes, and she had done it in her first-ever run for Congress. It was the biggest upset of the election season; an upstart Hispanic Democrat had managed to upstage Mr. Dornan, an Irish Catholic Republican stalwart, in his own Republican stronghold.
abstract: Interview with US Repr Loretta Sanchez, freshman Democrat who remains relentlessly dogged by former Repr Robert K Dornan, 11 months after defeating eight-term Republican in hotly contested House race in Orange County, Calif; Dornan, who is disputing results, says election was stolen from him by bad ballots cast by people who were not American citizens, or who were illegal aliens; photo (M)

headline.main: Freshman Democrat Is Dogged by Relentless Foe
